verbLexeme: 1. To look through binoculars, or to adjust them so that you can clearly see the thing you want to look at.
nominalLexeme: 1. An instrument which is made up of two small telescopes joined together side by side, which you look through in order to see things which are a long way away. English = binoculars, field glasses.
oldEntry: Popular explanation: holding a pair of binoculars to the eyes.
